      • getInsertionIds

        public InsertionIds getInsertionIds(E entry)
        Description copied from interface: CustomIndexStrategy
        This is the function that is called on ingest to tell GeoWave how to index the entry within this custom index - the insertion IDs are a set of partition and sort keys, either of which could be empty or null as needed (with the understanding that each partition key represents a unique partition in the backend datastore)
        Specified by:
        getInsertionIds in interface CustomIndexStrategy<E,TextConstraints>
        Parameters:
        entry - the entry to be indexed on ingest
        Returns:
        the insertion IDs representing how to index the entry

      • getQueryRanges

        public QueryRanges getQueryRanges(TextConstraints constraints)
        Description copied from interface: CustomIndexStrategy
        This is the function that is called on query, when given a query with the constraints type. The constraints type can be any arbitrary type although should be persistable so that it can work outside of just client code (such as server-side filtering, map-reduce, or spark). The query ranges are a set of partition keys and ranges of sort keys that fully include all rows that may match the constraints.
        Specified by:
        getQueryRanges in interface CustomIndexStrategy<E,TextConstraints>
        Parameters:
        constraints - the query constraints
        Returns:
        query ranges that represent valid partition and ranges of sort keys that fully include all rows that may match the constraints

      • getQueryRanges

        public QueryRanges getQueryRanges(MultiDimensionalTextData textData)

      • getFilter

        public CustomIndexStrategy.PersistableBiPredicate<E,TextConstraints> getFilter(TextConstraints constraints)
        Description copied from interface: CustomIndexStrategy
        Optionally a custom index strategy can enable additional filtering beyond just the query ranges (termed "fine-grained" filtering in documentation). This requires reading rows from disk and evaluating a predicate so it is inherently slower than using query ranges but it is flexible enough to handle any additional evaluation criteria required.
        Specified by:
        getFilter in interface CustomIndexStrategy<E,TextConstraints>
        Returns:
        A predicate that should be used for "fine-grained" filter evaluation
